bibl.title: Literacy, Literate Practice, and the Law in the Roman Empire, A.D. 100-600.
bibl.note: Diss. Yale Univ. Summary in DA 50 (1989-1990) p. 3708-A. - The phenomenon is studied in wills in particular. The social context is determined through literary, papyrological, and epigraphic evidence.
bibl.seg: Meyer Elizabeth Anne, Literacy, Literate Practice, and the Law in the Roman Empire, A.D. 100-600.
Diss. Yale Univ. Summary in DA 50 (1989-1990) p. 3708-A. - The phenomenon is studied in wills in particular. The social context is determined through literary, papyrological, and epigraphic evidence.
